image.altText: A notebook with the words "Susan Bartlett Suzanne Armstrong murders of 147 Easey St Collingwood"

props.synopsis: Detectives have been praised for collecting and preserving DNA materials during the original Easey Street investigation at a time when little was known about the use of the science in criminal cases.

title.children: Police investigating the Easey Street killings lauded for using a forensic practice that was yet to prove its worth

image.altText: The outside of the County Court of Victoria building.

props.synopsis: A Melbourne man engaged in "deceptive" conduct when he raped a woman during a house party and tried to cover it up, prosecutors say.

title.children: Melbourne man faked evidence to cover up house party rape, court told

image.altText: A conflict played out in shadows.

props.synopsis: New data, released to coincide with the 16 Days of Activism against Gender-Based Violence, shows more people are seeking support when at imminent risk across central Victoria.

title.children: Service warns more people are seeking help when facing imminent risk

image.altText: Caleb sitting on the beach digging a hole in the sand smiling.

props.synopsis: An 84-year-old woman is facing charges including fail to render assistance following the fatal collision west of Geelong in March.

title.children: Elderly woman charged over alleged hit-run crash that killed 6yo boy

image.altText: A woman taking a selfie with a man and three young children, whose faces have been blurred.

props.synopsis: The family's alternative lifestyle came under scrutiny after the British-Australian couple and their three children were hospitalised last year with mushroom poisoning.

title.children: Children removed from Australian mum living off-grid in Italian forest

image.altText: A woman stands outside a cafe

props.synopsis: While Porepunkah residents are trying to move on from the tragic deaths of two police officers, there is one person they are eager to forget.

title.children: As Porepunkah tries to move on, one name remains too painful to hear

image.altText: A middle-aged man in a firefighter's uniform stands with his arms folded in what appears to be a fire station locker room.

props.synopsis: The ABC can reveal that in 2023 the Victorian government blocked Fire Rescue Victoria from pursuing legal action against PFAS manufacturer 3M.

title.children: Fire service blocked from pursuing US giant over 'forever chemicals'

image.altText: Marilyn Warren, who has short brown hair, poses for a photo wearing a cream blazer

props.synopsis: Marilyn Warren made history when she was appointed chief justice of the Supreme Court of Victoria, though she has never thought of herself as a trailblazer.

title.children: She was a trailblazer for women in law. Her gender was, at times, a burden

image.altText: A pregnant stomach in focus with a midwife in the background at a desk

props.synopsis: A free "gold standard" antenatal care program is proving hugely popular and successful, but women are scrambling to get access.

title.children: Thousands of women missing out on 'gold standard' antenatal care

image.altText: A billboard that says "Future Mt Atkinson Town Centre" stands before a greenfield site in a country area.

props.synopsis: Locals are frustrated by hold-ups with a long-awaited shopping strip in Mt Atkinson, in Melbourne's major growth corridor in the west.

title.children: Is public consultation the reason this shopping centre has been delayed?

image.altText: A woman with long dark hair in a pink shirt and black skirt stands with her arm around a man in a blue shirt in a wheelchair.

props.synopsis: Stunt pilot Glenn Collins says he is excited but daunted as he faces "the biggest rehab of my life — going home".

title.children: Avalon Airshow stunt pilot returns home eight months after crash

image.altText: Australian tennis player Nick Kyrgios grimaces as he stretches his right arm out to hit a forehand.

props.synopsis: Nick Kyrgios's Australian Open wildcard campaign is on in earnest after the former Wimbledon runner-up was announced in the Kooyong Classic exhibition field.

title.children: Kyrgios's Australian Open wildcard bid heats up with Kooyong entry

image.altText: An aerial view of the Gold Coast canal network

props.synopsis: Home prices have risen by almost 50 per cent in the past five years, with more than a decade now needed to save for a standard 20 per cent deposit for a house in most capital cities, according to a new report.

title.children: 'Extraordinary' housing values crush home ownership dreams

image.altText: Ash Riddell pumps her fists as she celebrates an AFLW goal for North Melbourne.

props.synopsis: Overlooked in multiple drafts before making her debut in 2019, North Melbourne's Ash Riddell is now the best player in the league.

title.children: How Riddell's rise to become AFLW's best mirrors Kangaroos' dominance

image.altText: Rent for Amanda Mentiplay stands outside her house.

props.synopsis: Data released today shows rental affordability in regional parts of Australia has fallen in the last year, while the situation in most capital cities has not improved.

title.children: Rental affordability worsens in regions as 'dire' situation remains

image.altText: A sketch of a man with grey hair and glasses in a grey jacket, white collared shirt and dark tie.

props.synopsis: Perry Kouroumblis's lawyer has questioned former officers about their handling of evidence in the 1977 murder case that the prosecution said relied on DNA.

title.children: Lawyer questions handling of DNA evidence in Easey Street murder

image.altText: a gravel car park

props.synopsis: A man charged over the alleged theft of a car from a supermarket car park which had a toddler inside has faced court.

title.children: Man fronts court charged over alleged theft of car with child inside

image.altText: The front of Victoria's Parliament House.

props.synopsis: A report found Victoria recorded an operating loss of $2.6 billion in 2024-25, adding to accumulated losses of $50.6 billion over the last 6 years.

title.children: Victoria's auditor-general reports $400 million government budget blowout

image.altText: A woman with red hair wearing all black and sunglasses.

props.synopsis: A Central Victorian drama and dance teacher is handed an 18-month jail term for raping a student at her home following an event.

title.children: Drama and music teacher sentenced for raping student after event

image.altText: A man standing in front of an Intersport store with its doors shut.

props.synopsis: Retail stores in north-west Victoria are taking their own measures to curb increasing retail crime.

title.children: Regional Victorian shops fight back against increasing retail crime

image.altText: A man in a yellow and red lifesaver uniform and lady in a suit stand on top of a sandbag wall in front of a building on a beach.

props.synopsis: Inverloch residents are "infuriated" by the Victorian government's delay in spending $3 million in federal funding to help fix coastal erosion.

title.children: Residents furious as FOI reveals failure to act on coastal erosion

image.altText: A headshot of Sussan Ley speaking.

props.synopsis: The optics of rolling the Liberal Party's only woman leader when NSW and Victoria have managed to elevate traditional "small-l liberal" candidates is playing on the minds of some members.

title.children: Ley faces big test and also a big opportunity in final week

image.altText: An underground rail station.

props.synopsis: The United Firefighters Union has asked the national rail safety authority to investigate the validity of a permit to run services in Melbourne's Metro Tunnel, which will begin running passenger services on Sunday.

title.children: Firefighters union questions Metro Tunnel safety permit

image.altText: A close up shot of blue and white police tape at night.

props.synopsis: Police allege a 16-year-old boy has slashed an 80-year-old man with a knife while trying to steal his wallet in the car park of the railway station in Melbourne's outer east.

title.children: Teen charged after elderly man slashed at Lilydale Station

image.altText: A close up of a smiling woman.

props.synopsis: There are a lot of misconceptions about voting, particularly among marginalised groups. But these "democracy ambassadors" are working hard to ensure everyone knows their rights.

title.children: Kiki was told she couldn't vote in prison, now she's debunking that myth

image.altText: Senator Sarah Hanson-Young sits down for an interview with Insiders host David Speers.

props.synopsis: The ABC has been told the federal government is willing to ensure native forestry complies with tougher new standards within three years if the Greens back the reforms.

title.children: Labor offers Greens forestry deal in exchange for support on environment laws

image.altText: A closure sign posted to the front door of a childrens' gymnastics club in Berwick

props.synopsis: The ABC understands a registered sex offender and part-owner of Funtastic Gymnastics in Berwick, Steven Andrew Smith, is the subject of a complaint made to Gymnastics Australia.

title.children: Child safety investigation into registered sex offender gym owner

image.altText: A young man in a green shirt smells alcohol contained in a small glass.

props.synopsis: A Victorian farmer is making unique alcoholic drinks from unconventional crops.

title.children: This young farmer is turning beets and red wheat into quirky spirits

image.altText: male priest wears green liturgical robes holding a silver chalice. another older man in khaki shirt holds out hand to receive

props.synopsis: Without 11 Pacific Islander ministers serving parishes in north Queensland, the region's Anglican church would collapse, according to bishop Keith Joseph.

title.children: How migrant and overseas Christians are helping keep Australian churches alive

image.altText: Two people on a roof top share a kiss, with city buildings in the background.

props.synopsis: Long-running global hit If You Are the One returns to Australia to recruit contestants from a younger generation, many who do not prioritise marriage. Here is why the show is still relevant.

title.children: 'Mismatch' between Gen Z and Beijing captured on China's dating show

image.altText: Blaithin Bogue of the Kangaroos kicks a goal.

props.synopsis: North Melbourne will play in its third consecutive AFLW grand final after weathering an almighty scare from Melbourne.

title.children: 'Stressful the whole game': Kangaroos star on being challenged by Dees

image.altText: A grinning Brisbane Lions AFLW player stares straight at the camera as her teammates surround her after a goal.

props.synopsis: The Brisbane Lions will meet North Melbourne in the AFLW decider for a third straight season after a crushing 35-point preliminary final defeat of Carlton.

title.children: Svarc plug: Ruby dazzles as Lions' blitz ends Blues

image.altText: Red and black flags with the acronym CMFEU flying in the wind.

props.synopsis: An inquiry has heard violence was the "cancer" in Queensland's CFMEU branch. Here's what we have learned from the first week of public hearings.

title.children: Violence and a secret scheme: What we've learnt from the CFMEU probe

image.altText: A police blockade in Melbourne's CBD

props.synopsis: A bombmaker who created "homemade napalm" and whose arrest led to evacuations in Melbourne's CBD has been jailed for eight years.

title.children: Man boasted homemade bombs could 'legit bring down a whole apartment building'

image.altText: Four of Afghan football team, two in hijab, place hands on chest and sing, three children, also in jersey stand in front.

props.synopsis: After four years in exile, some of Afghanistan's female footballers have returned to the pitch, giving hope to those still in the country, fighting for basic rights.

title.children: Afghan women's football team's international comeback defies Taliban ban
